title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Welcome and introduction to the Amstat client webinar series. Sonia Burke, Customer Service Manager, and Jessica Simmons, Customer Service Specialist, greet attendees and explain the purpose of the webinar series. Each session will focus on showcasing a specific function of the Amstat Premiere and Connect services. The webinars are designed to be concise and informative, helping users maximize the benefits of the service. Attendees are encouraged to ask questions via the chat feature at the end of the session.

metadata.topic: Webinar Series Introduction and Format Overview

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Introduction to the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder feature. Most attendees are familiar with the basic criteria search in Amstat platforms, but this session focuses on the advanced list builder and its benefits. The advanced builder allows users to search by specific makes, models, and territories, combining multiple territories and models into a single report without needing to merge multiple Excel files. It consolidates results into one tab within the application and offers additional search features to customize reports.

metadata.topic: Overview and Benefits of the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Demonstration of the Advanced List Builder within the Criteria Search, focusing on aircraft data. The session highlights that while the example uses aircraft, the advanced builder also applies to company transactions and changes. Upon opening the criteria search for aircraft, it defaults to the Quick List Builder, but switching to the Advanced Builder reveals additional features. Users can search by make, model, aircraft type, or registration number. The interface allows expanding makes to select multiple models across different makes and selecting specific aircraft types with detailed breakdowns.

metadata.topic: Using the Advanced List Builder for Aircraft Search: Make, Model, and Type Selection

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Advanced search by registration number feature. This allows users to copy and paste a list of tail numbers from external sources or previous work, streamlining the search process. Instead of entering tail numbers individually in the keyword search, users can input them all at once in the Advanced Builder to generate a report on specific aircraft. The example continues by selecting jets for the search criteria.

metadata.topic: Registration Number Search and Bulk Tail Number Input

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Location-based search options in the Advanced List Builder. Users can select search regions or enter specific territories manually by typing. The presenter demonstrates entering specific U.S. territories—New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania—to narrow the search instead of selecting the entire U.S. region. The summary of selected territories updates dynamically on the right side of the interface, providing clear feedback on the search scope.

metadata.topic: Selecting Specific Territories and Regions for Targeted Searches

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Additional filtering options to refine search results based on specific criteria. Users can filter aircraft by sale status (for sale or not for sale), price range, total time, ownership type (including fractional ownership programs), financing options, recent utilization, age, and certification. These filters allow users to create highly targeted reports tailored to their specific business needs or interests, enhancing the usefulness of the search results.

metadata.topic: Applying Advanced Filters: Sale Status, Ownership, Financing, and Utilization

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Running the search and interpreting the report results. Unlike the Quick List Builder, which generates separate tabs for each territory searched, the Advanced List Builder consolidates all selected territories into a single report tab. This unified report simplifies reference and management by grouping all prospects and contacts together. Users can save, export, or print the report easily. Exporting generates one file without the need to merge multiple spreadsheets manually.

metadata.topic: Consolidated Report Generation and Export Benefits

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Modifying existing reports without restarting the search process. Users can click 'modify criteria search' directly from the report view, which reopens the Advanced List Builder with previously entered criteria saved. This feature allows quick adjustments or additions to the search parameters, streamlining workflow and saving time when refining reports.

metadata.topic: Efficient Report Modification Using Saved Search Criteria

title: Why Use the Criteria Search Advanced List Builder
chunk_text: Closing remarks and invitation to the next webinar scheduled for October 23rd. The upcoming session will build on this one by focusing on saving searches, accessing saved searches, and the benefits of having saved searches on the user dashboard. Attendees are thanked for their participation and encouraged to ask questions. Contact information is provided for one-on-one demos or private inquiries, especially for Connect customers interested in features demonstrated in the Premiere version.

metadata.topic: Webinar Conclusion, Next Session Preview, and Support Contact Information
